p: In a pandemic setting, investigational products (IPs) to be tried would be approved drugs that are repurposed. The selection of IP could be based on in vitro evidence of antiviral activity or plausible disease-modifying mechanisms. However, there would be concerns about the use of IP in the absence of additional preclinical evidence of efficacy and safety.[ 2] Selection of investigational interventions for Ebola was based on the World Health Organization's (WHO) ethical framework-Monitored Emergency Use of Unregistered Interventions. This framework recommends that supporting data for the intervention's efficacy and safety should be available, at least from laboratory or animal studies.[ 3] The recently concluded Lopinavir Trial for Suppression of SARS-Cov-2 in China (LOTUS China) COVID-19 was conducted based on its in vitro activity against SARS-Cov. In this trial, lopinavir–ritonavir plus standard care was compared to standard care alone.[ 1] Lopinavir–ritonavir group did not show any benefit in primary endpoint – time to improvement – or secondary endpoint – 28-day mortality.
